body_html: Throwing an error is an option. For consistency I'd prefer to throw an error if the tensor isn't scalar as well. Unfortunately, absorbing either change would require verifying that all the downstream code doesn't (weirdly) depend on this behavior, which makes it hard to do from the outside.
body_text: Throwing an error is an option.  For consistency I'd prefer to throw an error if the tensor isn't scalar as well.  Unfortunately, absorbing either change would require verifying that all the downstream code doesn't (weirdly) depend on this behavior, which makes it hard to do from the outside.
body: Throwing an error is an option.  For consistency I'd prefer to throw an error if the tensor isn't scalar as well.  Unfortunately, absorbing either change would require verifying that all the downstream code doesn't (weirdly) depend on this behavior, which makes it hard to do from the outside.
